thread.title: AFL Confidential: Bryce Gibbs in a Twitter blue and Cam Newton joins Richmond | The
thread.title_full: AFL Confidential: Bryce Gibbs in a Twitter blue and Cam Newton joins Richmond | The Advertiser

author: Max Laughton
title: AFL Confidential: Bryce Gibbs in a Twitter blue and Cam Newton joins Richmond | The
text:
IT was only a few weeks ago that Carlton and Port Adelaide fought out a thriller at the MCG, resulting in the Blues‚Äô second win for the season.
But it seems as if there‚Äôs some unfinished business between the two teams based on a Twitter conversation last night.
Bryce Gibbs was suspended for two games after his sling tackle on the Power‚Äôs Robbie Gray. So when Port's Jay Schulz escaped sanction for what appeared to be a similar tackle against Sydney on Thursday night, he tweeted this:
I'm confused...
‚Äî Bryce Gibbs (@BGibbsy4) July 6, 2015 As always, Gibbs received plenty of replies, but the most visible was from an actual Power player, as Sam Colquhoun defended his teammate.
@BGibbsy4 two actions pal
‚Äî Sam Colquhoun (@SamColquhoun) July 6, 2015 It didn‚Äôt stop there though, with Zach Tuohy jumping in to side with Gibbs.
@SamColquhoun @BGibbsy4 kidding yourself "pal"!!!
‚Äî Zach Tuohy (@zach2e) July 6, 2015
And so Carlton v Port Adelaide was declared the greatest footy rivalry in all of social media. By us, right now.
UPDATE: The war continues!
Two days after Colquhoun‚Äôs jibe, Gibbs found the perfect material to get back at him.
The Blue tweeted this out after Port Adelaide dropped Colquhoun for this week‚Äôs game.
@SamColquhoun unlucky... 'Pal' #portVlegs
‚Äî Bryce Gibbs (@BGibbsy4) July 8, 2015 We hope there‚Äôs a good pharmacy open late in Adelaide with ointment in stock.
Colquhoun tried his best, inviting Gibbs for a look at his game in the seconds.
@BGibbsy4 come for a look?
‚Äî Sam Colquhoun (@SamColquhoun) July 8, 2015
RICHMOND‚ÄôS NEWEST RECRUIT
IF they‚Äôre going to have to take on his current contract, he might not fit in the salary cap, with a $31 million guarantee.
But star NFL quarterback Cam Newton of the Carolina Panthers paid a visit to Richmond over the weekend, including a visit to training this week.
The Tigers will undoubtedly be hoping that the talent that saw him lead his Auburn University football team (also named the Tigers) to a shock championship in 2010 can help them get over the premiership hump.
QB of the @Panthers , @CameronNewton takes in some Richmond match day hospitality #AFLTigersGiants #gotiges pic.twitter.com/UAIElh85tX
‚Äî Richmond FC (@Richmond_FC) July 4, 2015 And while his footy skills aren‚Äôt bad for a complete novice‚Ä¶
"I can honestly say I don't know what I'm doing" @Panthers QB @CameronNewton learning some new skills @Richmond_FC pic.twitter.com/eNysS4PIwQ
‚Äî Andrew McCormack (@_AMcCormack) July 7, 2015 ‚Ä¶they might want to be careful asking him to show them everything he can do on the gridiron.
Careful when you ask @CameronNewton to throw a hard one with his off-season arm @BrettDeledio03 @Panthers pic.twitter.com/tNCZK4DNBs
‚Äî Richmond FC (@Richmond_FC) July 6, 2015 #WeFlyAsOne
BEAUTIFUL tributes flowed throughout the footy world for Phil Walsh this weekend. Here are some of the highlights.
From coaches‚Ä¶
So sad to hear of Phil Walshs death. No sense to it. We are all flesh and blood. Love each other. Thoughts with all family and friends.
‚Äî Nathan Buckley (@ncb_cfc) July 2, 2015 To players‚Ä¶
Eerie, moving scenes at the MCG. Well done @Richmond_FC and @GWSGIANTS - class act. #AFLTigersGiants pic.twitter.com/L5JiOUsEDZ
‚Äî FOX FOOTY LIVE (@FOXFootyLive) July 4, 2015 To other AFL teams‚Ä¶
#PutYourScarvesOut pic.twitter.com/LZla0PyGbZ
‚Äî Geelong Cats (@GeelongCats) July 5, 2015 To other footy teams all over the country‚Ä¶
#RIPWalshy pic.twitter.com/mlA4egMZ1H
‚Äî Ian Nutsy Callinan (@callinan37) July 5, 2015 To the incredible fans in Adelaide.
First quarter at #AdelaideOval #weflyasone #RIPPhilWalsh pic.twitter.com/iYa6DvpAmT
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 5, 2015 Silence #weflyasone #RIPPhilWalsh pic.twitter.com/qlHu5BGVx3
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 5, 2015 EAGLE FANS ROCK
IT will undoubtedly be an emotional game on Saturday night when the Adelaide Crows return to action against the West Coast Eagles, two of the teams where Phil Walsh was a coach.
For this week, Eagles fans on popular site Reddit have redecorated their ‚Äòsubreddit‚Äô, or subsection of the site, to pay some measure of tribute to Walsh.
The West Coast Eagles fans on Reddit have redesigned their area of the website to pay tribute to Phil Walsh. Source: Supplied
They‚Äôve also invited Crows fans to join in their usually parochial discussions.
It‚Äôs another kind act from the AFL community, which has shown how truly great it can be over this incredibly tough time.
RETURN OF THE LITTLE MASTER
IF his dad was God, we guess that means that His son has risen. Or perhaps his Sun.
Apologies for the awful puns, but we‚Äôve missed discussing Gary Ablett. Nat Fyfe‚Äôs incredible season has seen him overtake Ablett in the eyes of many for the title of best current player but Ablett reminded us how good he can be this weekend, as he inspired Gold Coast to just their second win of the season, an upset over North Melbourne.
And didn‚Äôt Twitter love it!
The legend himself @GaryAblettJnr . #AFLSunsNorth pic.twitter.com/yJkVOzYb6N
‚Äî Yvonne W (@yvonne_w93) July 4, 2015
31 possessions, 11 clearances, 7 inside 50s & 3 goals. The little master was clinical tonight üëº üëº üëº #AFLSunsNorth pic.twitter.com/u98TG5CkFc
‚Äî GC SUNS (@GoldCoastSUNS) July 4, 2015 Although we would imagine that a certain someone with a sore back was less impressed, and the constant cuts to his reactions were definitely missed.
Meanwhile at Brad Scott's house #AFLSunsNorth pic.twitter.com/b8MxmtRK0a
‚Äî Non Sensible Kate (@nonsensiblekate) July 4, 2015 NOT SAFE FOR WORK ‚Äî THE PICTURE OR THE PUNS
COME on guys, stop having a crack at Nat Fyfe.
Let‚Äôs just turn the other cheek.
This whole thing is a bit beyond the pale.
Lucky he wasn‚Äôt playing on Collingwood‚Äôs number 22.
Proud of the effort from the boys last night. We were in with a sniff, just couldn't quite hold on. pic.twitter.com/WwhS4UwExG
‚Äî jack redden (@reddo30) July 6, 2015 (Sorry.)
LEAPING LINDSAY
NORTH Melbourne would be filthy at their shock loss to the Suns on Saturday, but just as filthy was the hang-time on Lindsay Thomas‚Äô mark of the year contender.
Adam Saad provided him an Uber service, giving Thomas as long as he needed to pull down an impressive grab.
"LINDSAY! He hung up there for an eternity!" http://t.co/73CleTUcMA #AFLSunsNorth pic.twitter.com/fIlouZcMCA
‚Äî FOX FOOTY LIVE (@FOXFootyLive) July 4, 2015 Seriously, I could watch that Lindsay Thomas mark on repeat forever. Just‚Ä¶wow. #AFLSunsNorth
‚Äî DJ (@dj_2) July 4, 2015 Lindsay Thomas channelling his inner Warwick Capper at Carrara. Seems appropriate. Killer grab. #AFLSunsNorth
‚Äî Hendo (@HendoHoops) July 4, 2015 DONS FANDOM BURNS OUT
BUT the group feeling the most disappointed about on-field results this week has to be Essendon, after their historically bad loss to St Kilda.
An Essendon membership goes like their 2015 season has ‚Äî up in flames. Source: Supplied
Bombers fan ‚ÄòLuke from Wallan‚Äô was particularly upset when he threw what appeared to be his membership card into a fireplace.
To spoil the fun, the Herald Sun found out the real story , but let‚Äôs just play along.
James Hird said it's hard to win with 7 players or more under 50 games. St Kilda has 8 today. #AFLDonsSaints
‚Äî Ethan (@ethan_meldrum) July 5, 2015 St Kilda‚Äôs David Armitage was one beneficiary of the poor Bombers, as seen here in slightly smaller form.
Armo in a hospital after being treated for leather poisoning following yesterday's win. #AFLdonssaints #getwellsoon pic.twitter.com/xOYXDUyA4Z
‚Äî Micro Lyf (@MicroLyf) July 6, 2015 PIC OF THE WEEK
#WeFlyAsOne Source: Getty Images
VIDEO OF THE WEEK
Monster kicker does it again, VFL player kicks 88m torpedo 0:49 Play video
AFL: Last week Tom Fields' 80 metre torpedo in the VFL went viral, this week he kicked one even further.
Fox Sports 06 Jul 2015 Sport/AFL/News CLUB TWEET OF THE WEEK
WE‚ÄôRE not sure if starting Trent Dumont on the ground would‚Äôve gotten North Melbourne over the line, but according to Roos fans, it might have at least helped.
A live look at our Twitter mentions after announcing the substitute #aflsunsnorth pic.twitter.com/yIPihubeK3
‚Äî North Melbourne (@NMFCOfficial) July 4, 2015 THE NUMBER
1 ‚Äî that‚Äôs how many games James Hird has either played in or coached in the AFL where he has lost by 100 points or more. That one game was this past weekend‚Äôs loss to St Kilda.
MOST MENTIONED MATCH
1. #aflpieshawks
2. #afldonssaints
3. #aflswanspower
4. #afltigersgiants
5. #aflsunsnorth
MOST MENTIONED TEAM
1. @adelaide_fc
2. @collingwoodfc
3. @hawthornfc
4. @essendonfc
5. @pafc
MOST POPULAR TWEETS
We are shocked and saddened by the sudden passing of Senior Coach Phil Walsh http://t.co/fMqBz8195F pic.twitter.com/vuBMCAQ5sE
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 3, 2015 Remarkable @CollingwoodFC @HawthornFC #weflyasone üëèüëè pic.twitter.com/u3tWTdaqC8
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 3, 2015 #sidebyside #weflyasone pic.twitter.com/jIMA4nxrh5
‚Äî Collingwood FC (@CollingwoodFC) July 3, 2015 On behalf of everyone at our Club, thank you for all the support and messages of love and support pic.twitter.com/WHAtUmYrhH
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 3, 2015 Thank you #weflyasone pic.twitter.com/9QqXJ8nfH5
‚Äî Adelaide Crows (@Adelaide_FC) July 3, 2015 My condolences, and those of the whole team, to the family and friends of Phil Walsh, the AFL community and the Crows. Very sad.
‚Äî Michael Clarke (@MClarke23) July 3, 2015 There are no words...a sincere thx to all @Adelaide_FC fans & entire football community for the extraordinary support they've provided today
‚Äî Andrew Fagan (@Fages1) July 3, 2015 On behalf of the @storm and the entire Rugby League community, our deepest condolences go out to the Walsh family and the @Adelaide_FC
‚Äî Cameron Smith (@camsmith9) July 2, 2015 Originally published as Gibbs in Twitter blue: AFL Confidential
